Result Filters

Source: R/docs-filters.R
search_filters.Rd

You can specifiy additional search filters in some functions. These filters are documented in the official API reference. For convenience, all supported filters are implemented as explicit, named arguments.

Arguments

query

character(1): Search titles and descriptions.
years

integer(1): 4-digit year or range, e.g. 2010-2020. Can also be an integer vector of length two which will be coerced appropriately.
genres

character(n): Genre slug(s). See genres for a table of genres. Multiple values are allowed and will be concatenated.
languages

character(n): Two-digit language code(s). Also see languages for table of available languages.
countries

character(n): Two-character country code(s). See countries.
runtimes

character | integer: Integer range in minutes, e.g. 30-90. Can also be an integer vector of length two which will be coerced appropriately.
ratings

character | integer: Integer range between 0 and 100. Can also be an integer vector of length two which will be coerced appropriately.
certifications

character(n): Certification(s) like pg-13. Multiple values are allowed. Use certifications for reference. Note that there are different certifications for shows and movies.
networks

character(n): (Shows only) Network name like HBO. See networks for a list of known networks.
status

character(n): (Shows only) The status of the shows. One of returning series, in production, planned, canceled, or ended

See also

automated_lists, where these parameters are used
